enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Engineering Students. Other students can register for this section with permission from the department.
title: WCAS MATH 234-0-67 Multiple Integration and Vector Calculus

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Cylindrical and spherical coordinates, double and triple integrals, line and surface integrals. Change of variables in multiple integrals; gradient, divergence, and curl. Theorems of Green, Gauss, and Stokes. Students may not receive credit for both 234 and 281-1, 285-3, 290-3, or 291-3. Prerequisite: 230.

THIS COURSE HAS MANDATORY EVENING MIDTERM EXAMINATIONS. PLEASE CHECK THE REGISTRAR'S WEBPAGE FOR DETAILS: http://www.registrar.northwestern.edu/registration/midterms.html

This exam takes precedence over scheduled meetings of other classes, including labs and discussion sections, held at this time, and it is up to the student to make arrangements for handling conflicts arising from such meetings. In special circumstances, arrangements for dealing with other unavoidable conflicts can be made by alerting the course coordinator at least two weeks ahead of time; he/she will decide if your conflict can be accommodated.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Student will learn cylindrical and spherical coordinate systems, double and triple integrals, line and surface integrals, change of variables in multiple integrals; gradient, divergence, and curl, theorems of Green, Gauss, and Stokes.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lecture and discussion sections meet three times a week. Classes are accompanied by discussion sections, which meet one day a week for problem solving and discussion under the supervision of a teaching assistant.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Students may not receive credit for both 234-0 and any of the following: 281-1, 285-3, 290-3, or 291-3.
